content: hey folks, i can't make the meeting today, sorry. see you later!

let's start then?

now they have the notification in case they want to follow :)

Are there any specific topics besides checking in? Anything anyone wants to bring up?

not a topic really, but have a small AOB item for the end
AOB?
any other business. it's a term Daniel introduced to me, but i've become fond of it
(yeah i'm also between two meetings)
Then who wants to start?
rustfmt then rustdoc?
then we can do cargo adn clippy

sure, for rustfmt

    - Not much since last time, I didn’t have as much free time as I'd hope and didn’t get to work on the things I was hoping to
    - Mostly just some minor bug fixes/feature improvements
    - A new active contributor I’m trying to support in the hopes they may be able to join the team down the road
apologies for the formatting, trying to get used to zulip

rustdoc now:

 - We now use the correct syntax highlighting based on the edition
 - Cleanup still in progress
 - Multiple bugs fixed

• We now use the correct syntax highlighting based on the edition

This one's about the syntax highlighting lint right? (invalid_rust_codeblocks)
yes
and the "scrape examples/" pr is about to land
I'm very excited for that :)

Seems like we're done with the updates? You wanted to talk about something else Caleb Cartwright ?

nothing from cargo or clippy first?

yeah so for clippy we've been trundling along
some interesting items came up today
No sorry, I don't have any particular updates. Just regular things going on.
• Our tests still run on old editions. We should fix that https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy/issues/7842
• We do a lot of work to resugar expanded macros, would be nice if we could avoid that https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy/issues/7843
input welcome on both
@Caleb Cartwright go for it

Manish Goregaokar said:

  • Our tests still run on old editions. We should fix that https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy/issues/7842

FYI, not a big deal, but you said // edition:2018 in the issue, but I think you mean 2021.
(sorry i got pulled into my meeting)
lol ty

AOB item

Completely unrelated to dev tools, but @GuillaumeGomez wanted to give you a shout out and thank you for your work in the gtk-rs space which I've found extremely useful (I assume that's you over there anyway :smile:).

One of the other projects I work on is Shields.io, which is the service that provides the majority of those status badges you see scattered across the internet. The badge requests we receive are overwhelmingly for SVGs but we also provide PNGs and have a separate microservice that handles rasterization.

We recently rewrote that rasterization microservice from a Node.js with Puppeteer & Chromium implementation to a Rust-based API that utilizes the bindings for Cairo, Gio and GLib and that change has been a massive win for us. It's provided a ~90% savings on hosting costs, and allows us to serve better badges (emoji support, letter spacing, etc.) with lower response times (and that's despite me lazily/clumsily stumbling my way through the implementation!)

Obviously all of those benefits don't necessarily come _directly_ from Rust, but the migration as a whole is what allowed us to realize those benefits, and those gtk-rs bindings were a crucial piece of being able to make that migration happen, so thank you!
Wow great! It seems like more and more projects are using gtk-rs instead of gtk, this is so great :D
we needed to use the librsvg lib too so Rust was just a perfect fit all around
librsvg is a complete rust rewrite for the libsvg made by Federico (the founder of GNOME)
it was one of the projects that allowed us to have direct feedback on gtk-rs "quality"
You have no idea how happy I am to see that gtk-rs is now becoming "mainstream"
it was how I learned rust back in 2013 haha
(yep, starting to act like an old person telling his own history, I stop now, promise)
I guess the meeting is over now?

Noah Lev said:

I guess the meeting is over now?

yeah seems like it. see you all next month (even though this last one felt like it went past in 30 minutes)

Glad to know it's not just me who feels that time has sped up recently :)
